name: XML Multilanguage Sitemap Generator
author: Marco Giannini

sections.description:
XML Multilanguage Sitemap Generator creates for you a wonderful sitemap which follow all the Google’s istructions.

It works fine without any multilanguage plugin but it gives all of his power with one of these active.
Please read HOW TO SET THIS PLUGIN PROPERLY and FAQ before asking any questions

How to set this plugin properly

After installed the plugin, click on XML sitemap in sidemenu.
Check every Post Type you want on your sitemap and simply click Create sitemap.
That’s it. Easy. No need set complicated options for multilanguage sitemap. If XMG find multilanguage plugin it will creates the sitemap for it.

Multilanguage Plugin Support

At the moment it supports only Polylang and WPML. Open a topic in support for require extra plugin support.

Any other Business

If this plugin helps you, feel free to donate me a coffee (coffee’s never enough) or leave me a feedback.

If you have some suggestions for extra options or for something new, feel free to mail me at info@marcogiannini.net.

For any problem I ask you to open a support topic.

Follow me on Facebook and on my Website.

Credits
Thanks to Marco Longobardi for develop helps.
Thanks to Marco Fatticcioni for logo design.

2.0.1

  • Resolved a bug caused by bad uploaded files.

2.0.0

  • Biggest update ever.
  • Add supports to taxonomies.
  • Completely rewritten code for better readability and better speed.
  • Completely revisioned UI.
  • Removed useless options.
  • Removed (ATM) images in sitemap.

1.5.0

  • Minor bug resolved.

1.4.9

  • Update for a bug with Polylang.

1.4.8

  • Minor bug resolved for WPML. Thanks to @ltamburo for the fix.
  • Minor bug resolved.

1.4.7

  • Adjust a problem which causes a lot of page load. IMPORTANT UPDATE!

1.4.6

  • Solved a bug with Avada

1.4.2

  • Solved UX bugs

1.4

  • UX for option page improved.
  • Added support for changefreq and priority. Now they can be set up inside the options page. There’s a bulk choice or a single choice for every post type.

1.3.1

  • Solved multilanguage bug with WPML.
  • Solved multilanguage bugs.

1.3

  • Solved minor bug.
  • Now is available the INDEX-SITEMAP.

1.2.1

  • Solved a conflict bug with WordPress.

1.2

  • Better user interface.
  • Added auto-creation of the sitemap.

1.1.1

  • Solved minor bug of the media inside sitemap.

1.1

  • First major update
  • Solved a Alternate URL bug with WPML.
  • Added image support inside the sitemap.
  • Solved minor bug.

1.0.5

  • Solved minor bug.

1.0.4

  • Solved minor bug.

1.0.3

  • Hard bug fixes. Please update this plugin.

1.0.2

  • Some bug fixes.

1.0.1

  • Changed the Logo. Thanks to Marco Fatticcioni for logo design.
  • Setted a default name for the sitemap generated.
sections.installation:
1. Download and activate this plugin. You can download it directly from WordPress plugin page and then upload it on your website, or search it directly from the plugin section of your website, searching XML MULTILANGUAGE SITEMAP.
  2. Go to XML SITEMAP.
  3. optional – Set the name of your sitemap.
  4. Check the post type you want to see inside your sitemap. press save options.
  5. optional – If you want to hide some posts from sitemap, check the title of the posts you want to hide.
  6. That’s it. Share your sitemap link to Google.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Download and activate this plugin. You can download it directly from WordPress plugin page and then upload it on your website, or search it directly from the plugin section of your website, searching XML MULTILANGUAGE SITEMAP.
  2. Go to XML SITEMAP.
  3. optional – Set the name of your sitemap.
  4. Check the post type you want to see inside your sitemap. press save options.
  5. optional – If you want to hide some posts from sitemap, check the title of the posts you want to hide.
  6. That’s it. Share your sitemap link to Google.

Why should I use this plugin instead of the more famous SEO plugins?

You should use this plugin because it follows perfectly the linear guides of Google. Is better to have Google as friend. And coooome on you can create a sitemap with just a CLICK ðŸ™‚

What if I want to include some extra post type in your sitemap?

That’s not an issue! You just have to go on your WordPress dashboard, under XML SITEMAP and check the post type you want to include. Check the installation guide for more informations.

What if I want to exclude some Post from my sitemap?

Again, no issues. Go on your WordPress dashboard, under XML SITEMAP and set the post type you want in your sitemap. Right after save the settings the list of posts will appear in the settings. Check the installation guide for more informations.

short_description: Create a Google friendly multilanguage sitemap in the root of the website. Usable also with single language. Google will say HOORAY!

upgrade_notice: UPDATE TO 2.0.1. There're a lot of new things. Taxonomies support. A new UI. A better code for future multilanguage plugin expansions. Compatibility with later version of WordPress.
